for_hash_set

Class UtilityMethods

  • java.lang.Object
    • for_hash_set.UtilityMethods

  • public class UtilityMethods
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to assist in constructing a GUI, including buttons, text fiels, labels, text areas and more
    Author:
    Heather Myers

      • makeButton

        public static javax.swing.JButton makeButton(int theX,
                                             int theY,
                                             int theWidth,
                                             int theHeight,
                                             java.lang.String theText,
                                             java.awt.Color theColor,
                                             java.awt.event.ActionListener theHandler,
                                             java.awt.Container theCP,
                                             boolean theEnabler)
        a method to construct a button
        Parameters:
        theX - an int to say where the button should go on the x axis
        theY - an int to say where the button should go on the y axis
        theWidth - an int to denote the width of the button
        theHeight - an int to denote the height of the button
        theText - a string to denote what the button should say
        theColor - the color of the button
        theHandler - the ActionListener of the button
        theCP - the container
        theEnabler - a boolean for whether the button should be enabled or not
        Returns:
        returns the button

      • makeTextField

        public static javax.swing.JTextField makeTextField(int theX,
                                                   int theY,
                                                   int theWidth,
                                                   int theHeight,
                                                   boolean theOpaque,
                                                   boolean theEnabler,
                                                   boolean theEdit,
                                                   java.lang.String theText,
                                                   java.awt.Container theCP)
        a method to contruct a text field
        Parameters:
        theX - an int to say where the TF should go on the x axis
        theY - an int to say where the TF should go on the y axis
        theWidth - an int to denote the width of the TF
        theHeight - an int to denote the height of the TF
        theOpaque - a boolean to control the opacity of the TF
        theEnabler - a boolean to control whether the TF is enabled
        theEdit - a boolean to control the editable state of the TF
        theText - a string to control what the TF says
        theCP - the container
        Returns:
        returns the textfield
